overview:
Self taught computer programmer, Entrepreneur born in England now based in Brazil.

At 16 (1984) was the first student to sit and pass O’Level computer science at his school in Kent, England.

Whilst at school launched a number of successful computer games for the then popular Texas TI99/4a and Commodore 64 Home computers.

Scored numerous No.1 hits in high street stores on both sides of the Atlantic with conversions such as Outrun[Sega] (biggest selling game of its time) and Road-blasters [Atari].

Has been involved in the initial set-up and running of numerous start-ups such as Findmycar.com an internet portal for luxury cars. In 2000 the online retailer claimed to have sold more Audi TT’s than any other retailer in the UK.

Martin is a self proclaimed protectionist and has a passion for product design, marketing and programming.

Currently living in Brazil, founder of Tillify.com.

milestones.description: Programmed US and European versions of OUTRUN CBM64 coin of conversion for US GOLD, UK and Mindscape US. Was at the time the biggest selling computer game worldwide.
Founder Findmycar.com portal for car buyers in the UK.
